summary:
I am a half-English, half-Dutch pragmatic idealist; a romantic utilitarian and a reluctant politician. I can be described as an emotionally articulate Aspergian, a 27-year old child who’s mature for his age, and an obsessive perfectionist who somehow intends to become a Homo Universalis – someone who metaphorically cannot sit still, but brings most of his ideas to life behind a desk.

Drive
I have been lucky enough to have excitement be the driving force behind everything I do. I have never been interested in money or susceptible to peer pressure – even when it might have been useful. Fortunately, our world is fascinating and fundamentally beautiful. My mission is to help as many people as possible to recognise that and to protect that state of things.

Interests
I have a very wide range of interests: I have developed a variant of chess in which players can hit their own pieces to combine them into stronger ones; drafted a script for a Lord of the Rings parody set in 16th century Frisia; developed a qualitatively appealing theory modifying Einsteinian gravity which turned out to fit with recent cosmological discoveries; written an epic fantasy novel about a world of my own creation, and learned cartography to create maps of it; and I am currently working on a number of non-fiction books and a browser game. I enjoy exploring new areas of natural beauty, and you will almost always find me there camera in hand. 

Work
My professional experience is still varied, but less so. Excluding an evening washing dishes at which I failed miserably, and a rather successful and enjoyable summer of 2013 programming devices for assembly lines, all my experience is in politics and education. I have managed to revitalise the youth organisation of the Party for the Animals. Its membership almost doubled, and its volunteerbase quadrupled, in the time that I was chairman. People became excited to be a part of it, just as my pupils became excited by science and abstract mathematics during the three years I taught at an international school.

projects.title: The Realm of Aponto Amtir
projects.description:
I was introduced to the game of Dungeons & Dragons towards the end of 2019, and immediately recognised its creative potential. A friend instructed me to create a character to play with, which seemed to require a history for him to know, a pantheon for him to worship, and a society for him to have been a part of. Before I knew it, I had built another world.

Aponto Amtir has a long history that seems to have exploded forth from the ether, with no pre-history to ground it in reality. Its beings are unsure about their place in the world; none of the flaura or fauna appear naturalised or settled; and the forceful arrow of time is about the only foundation on which individuals, peoples and empires attempt to form expectations of what is to come.

I am currently Dungeon Master (DM) for several groups, running seperate campaigns in the same world, and am developing a number of adventures which others could also use.

projects.title: Mathematics for the Curious
projects.description:
Mathematics is the language of the universe. Every area of knowledge and field of study relies on the critical, logical and creative thinking students can acquire through learning mathematics. Yet, students can’t see the point of the subject, and that’s hardly surprising.

Our aim as maths teachers should not be to have an answer ready when students ask what the point of maths is, our aim should be to prevent them ever feeling the need to ask the question.

Based on material developed and ammended throughout three years of teaching I am writing a mathematics book, which will cover every secondary school curriculum of the Netherlands and the IB MYP, but in a meaningful, possibly inspiring and hopefully enjoyable way.

The book will be divided into sections on numbers, algebra, analysis, calculus, sequences, geometry, trigonometry, probability and statistics. Students can move through these topics in various ways, based on what peaks their interest.

I am looking to work together with a publishing house which specialises in educational material to turn this project into a product which is suitable for the market. This is mainly a matter of graphic design and insight into commercial viability of particular physical features I would like the book to have.

projects.title: The Game of Trust
projects.description:
Many problems in the world arise because mutual trust is naturally difficult to maintain, even between reliable individuals and institutions.

The Game of Trust will be a browser game in which players form part of a country on a cube-world, and where game rounds consist of neighbouring countries facing the prisoner’s dilemma, choosing to cooperate or compete to earn points. The longer peace is maintained between countries, the more surprising a sudden choice to compete would be, and larger the reward. To avoid this temptation, countries can draft treaties, declarations and open channels of communication to maintain trust. Meanwhile, they can invest in developmental factors in which a similar choice between cooperation and competition presents itself, and internal politics also presents players with a stream of variations on the prisoner’s dilemma.

I would be very glad to work with others on the development of this game. I have very little programming experience, and am a complete graphic autodidact. The project is potentially huge, but I have identified several sensible phases of development, the first of which could be easily achieved.

projects.title: The Advent of Badness
projects.description:
The first part in an epic fantasy series, The Advent of Badness takes place in an apparently perfect world that has kept its inhabitants both blissful and hopelessly naive. When something happens that disturbs the certainties of the kU, they have no past experiences or understanding on which to base their response. The terrible things that occur, which they can neither distinguish nor comprehend, they simply label ‘badness’. As more and more of the society kU have created is infected by badness, the question arises whether there is anything in the nature of the kU that will allow them to confront and overcome this bizarre new aspect of their world.

I am currently in the process of rewriting the book, after learning more about the world it is set in and discovering that things could not have happened as I had assumed they would have in the first telling. I anticipate it will be the first of five novels in the series.

projects.title: Tales from a Spurious Realm
projects.description:
I have written a parody of the Lord of the Rings which takes place in an alternative version of 16th century Friesland, my home province. I have condensed the trilogy into two films, The Fellowship of the Necklace and The Tall Tales.

The films centre around a necklace of such great value, that it destroys the local economy wherever it’s taken by causing hyperinflation. The Cammingha’s of Ameland are intent on retrieving it, and as it has no power in a repressive state it cannot be used against them and must be destroyed.

courses.name: Free your creativity and get started on your book (Guardian Masterclass)

profile_positions.description:
Formalising a vision for the Animal Think Tank and developing a political strategy to make institutional power more receptive to grassroots demands for change.
Sharing in the joined responsibility of catalysing and supporting a social movement in the UK to challenge and eventually overcome the prejudice against and oppression of non-human individuals.
profile_positions.title: Political Strategist

profile_positions.description:
Enabling optimal functioning of the Dutch Party for the Animals, by ensuring sufficient structure, transparancy and democracy within the organisation.
Elected with a mandate to transform the party's approach to schooling and empower local and regional branches of the party, as well as strengthen the relationship with our youth organisation, PINK!.

The Party for the Animals is part of a global and growing movement that is committed to the interests of animals, nature and the environment in politics and public administration.
At time of writing (2019) they have 5 national parliamentarians, 2 senators, a European parliamentarian and 70 other elected officials throughout the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Voorzitter

profile_positions.description:
Bringing new impetus to the youth organisation for the Dutch Animal Welfare party; stimulating growth in number of active members in line with the increasing urgency and importance of its goals, which are (primarily):
- Recognition of animal sentience and its moral consequences
- And end to the measurement of our nation's success in terms of economic growth, and a focus on the various aspects of social progress instead
- Drastic measures to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and combat climate change
- Protection of the natural beauty of our planet
profile_positions.title: Landelijk voorzitter (Chairman of the National Board)

profile_positions.description: Teaching maths MYP3-5, both standard and extended. I have also taught science to VWO3 within TTO (tweetalig onderwijs) and maths to VWO4, again within TTO.
profile_positions.title: Mathematics teacher (MYP)

profile_positions.description: Setting up and running a maths club; developing materials for and teaching gifted pupils; supervisor and facilitator for homework classes
profile_positions.title: Special Education Teacher

profile_positions.description: Updating PLC software; drawing electronic schematics; designing HMI screen displays
profile_positions.title: Assistant

profile_positions.description: Teaching Maths to gifted pupils aged 8-12 (classes 5-8); Teaching English to class 8
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

volunteer_experiences.role: Active member of the workgroup Friesland
volunteer_experiences.description: Attending and contributing to the content of six-weekly meetings, campaigning during election times and writing guest columns for the regional newspaper.

volunteer_experiences.role: Voorzitter afdeling Noord-Nederland (Chairman of the branch for the Northern Netherlands)
volunteer_experiences.description:
Setting up & structuring a new branch of the youth organisation for the Dutch Animal Welfare party, for the provinces Friesland, Groningen and Drenthe.
Mostly my focus was on setting up a core team of dedicated and ambitious individuals who would be capable of managing an organisation with a huge growth potential.
http://www.pinkpolitiek.nl/pink/afdelingen/afdeling-noordnederland/
Ad hoc support of the political youth organisation at national and regional events
